sentence.Network_en: The Americans are adamant that they will not budge on this point.
sentence.Network_cn: 美国人非常强硬，他们在这一点上是不会妥协的。

sentence.Network_en: The prime minister is adamant that he will not resign.
Pearce remained adamant, saying "I didn't touch him"
sentence.Network_cn: 皮尔斯仍旧坚定不移地说：“我没有碰过他。”

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English  (as a noun), from Old French adamaunt-, via Latin from Greek, adamas adamant- 'untameable, invincible' (later used to denote the hardest metal or stone, hence diamond), from a- 'not' + daman 'to tame'. The phrase to be adamant dates from the 1930s, although adjectival use had been implied in such collocations as ‘an adamant heart’ since the 16th cent

entry.def: If someone is adamant about something, they are determined not to change their mind about it.

example.ex: The prime minister is adamant that he will not resign...
Sue was adamant about that job in Australia.
example.tran: 对澳大利亚的那份工作，休的态度很坚决。

means.word_mean: 1. very hard native crystalline carbon valued as a gem
1. not capable of being swayed or diverted from a course; unsusceptible to persuasion;

sentences.sentence: "he is adamant in his refusal to change his mind"
"Cynthia was inexorable; she would have none of him"- W.Churchill
"an intransigent conservative opposed to every liberal tendancy"

means.word_mean: 坚定不移的, 坚强不屈的

sentences.en: We are adamant on the building of a well-off society.
sentences.cn: 在建设小康社会这一点上，我们是坚定不移的。

sentences.en: Veronica was quite adamant that they should stay on.
sentences.cn: 维罗妮卡坚信他们必须继续留下去。
